description: The round payoff this round was 103. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 51.5.
Mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) maximizes individual payoff
Choosing option 2 unilaterally can lead to a higher payoff for the defector but at the cost of the other player receiving nothing
Mutual defection (both choosing option 2) results in a lower payoff for both players compared to mutual cooperation
The game resembles a variant of the Prisoner's Dilemma, where cooperation is collectively optimal but defection can be individually tempting
Past actions are observable, allowing for strategies like tit-for-tat or conditional cooperation
